alert.note: Alert for Renville; Ward (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 26 at 9:03AM CST until December 27 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero expected. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 8 inches, with locally higher amounts possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central North Dakota, including areas from the Turtle Mountains to the James River Valley. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM CST Monday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until Noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow with near whiteout conditions in rural areas. The hazardous conditions will impact the Monday morning commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Near whiteout conditions are possible in rural areas.
info.instruction: Persons should consider delaying all travel. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
